definition: lintel (of a door)/fig. family's social status

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
splendor shines on the family's door (idiom)/fig. to bring honor to one's family

sentences.english: Then we came to a tavern with vine-leaves over the lintel.
sentences.chinese: 我們來到一家酒館，門楣上爬滿籐蔓。

sentences.english: He carved this sentence on the gate of his school.
sentences.chinese: 他把這句話刻在他所辦學校的門楣上。

sentences.english: Film names reflect the contents of films.
sentences.chinese: 電影片名好比影片的門楣。

sentences.english: Visual downstairs to the provision of the South arch openings, recessed door was half-moon .
sentences.chinese: 鐘鼓樓下南向闢拱券門洞，門楣凹進呈半月形。

definition: door/the opening panel of a door
bell made of copper or bronze
lit. windswept and battered by rain/to undergo hardship (idiom)
